title: Stunning sunrise wows Britain – but wet and windy weather is on the way
text:
The amazing sunrise over Tower Bridge at around 7am this morning (Picture: Surjit Dhanjal)

Britain enjoyed a remarkable sunrise this morning, but it did not herald a warm day ahead.

Early risers were treated to shades of red and yellow contrasting brilliantly with the country’s scenery – but they are unlikely to be pleased with the weather for long.

After a colourful start, a few sunny spells are the best Brits can hope for, with the Met Office forecasting wet and windy conditions.

A spokeswoman for the forecaster said the next few days was likely to be ‘bright and breezy but with quite frequent and heavy showers right across the country’.

Turning to today specifically, she continued: ‘The showers will be heaviest and most frequent in the north and west.

A red deer silhouetted in front of an autumnal sunrise on the Woburn Estate, Bedfordshire (Picture: Ian Hull)

A ‘Golden Sunrise’ over the Golden Valley in the Herefordshire countryside this morning (Picture: Rex)

‘The showers will be blustery and with the possibility of hail and thunder mixed in.’

However, some eastern parts of England and Scotland may stay mostly dry.

A windy evening tonight is expected to see clear spells and blustery showers, with western Scotland and the far southwest of England and Wales likely seeing the heaviest showers.

Temperatures were expected to peak at around 18 – 19, before dropping off again to around 14 tomorrow.

An autumnal chill was felt in the valley as we entered the second week of October (Picture: Rex Features)

Do you have plans this afternoon? Be prepared to catch a heavy #shower or two if you're heading outside 🌦️☔️ pic.twitter.com/gnteah1yFY — Met Office (@metoffice) October 8, 2019

The Met Office are forecasting that tomorrow will be ‘windy with a mixture of sunny spells and showers.’

Thursday will see highs on 16 – 17, with a front pushing in from the Atlantic bringing some more persistent rain, particularly to the north and west.

The spokeswoman added that Friday would see a ‘bit of a north-south divide’, with southern areas expected to be colder with outbreaks of rain, while the north will see a mixture of sunshine and showers.

Temperatures are expected to peak at 18 – 19.

Over the weekend and into next week, the weather is expected to stay unsettled with further spells of rain, particularly on Sunday.

Showers or longer spells of rain are expected for all areas, but that temperatures look set to remain around the seasonal average.

description: Britain was treated to a stunning sunrise on Tuesday, October 8, but rain and wind are predicted for the week ahead.
